Smart Power Strip: A power strip with built-in sensors and AI capabilities to optimize power usage and automate plugged-in devices. The smart power strip can detect when a device is not in use and automatically turn it off, saving energy and money. It can also identify and prioritize devices based on their energy consumption, allowing users to make informed decisions about which devices to turn off.

Power Strip with Built-in Charging Docks: A power strip with built-in charging docks for multiple devices, such as smartphones, tablets, and laptops. The charging docks are designed to be compact and efficient, allowing users to charge their devices quickly and easily. The power strip can also be equipped with smart charging technology, such as fast charging or wireless charging, to provide users with the latest charging innovations.

Customizable Power Strip: A power strip that allows users to customize the layout and configuration of the outlets. Users can choose the number and position of the outlets, as well as the type of outlets (e.g., USB, HDMI, etc.). This customization feature allows users to tailor the power strip to their specific needs and preferences.

Power Strip with Integrated Surge Protection: A power strip with built-in surge protection to protect devices from power surges and spikes. The surge protection technology can detect and absorb power surges, preventing damage to devices and reducing the risk of electrical fires. The power strip can also be equipped with smart sensors to detect when a surge occurs and automatically shut off the power to prevent damage.

Portable Power Strip: A portable power strip that can be easily carried and used on the go. The power strip can be powered by a built-in battery or by plugging it into a wall outlet. This portability feature allows users to charge their devices anywhere, without the need for a separate power source. The power strip can also be designed with a compact and lightweight design, making it easy to carry in a backpack or bag.
